Solicitation Title: Landing Gear parts for Beechcraft B200  aircraft
Description Text: This notice is a combined synopsis/solicitation for commercial items prepared in accordance with the format in FAR Sub-part 12.6, as supplemented with additional information included in this notice. This announcement constitutes the only solicitation; offers are being requested and a written solicitation will not be issued.This notice is being issued as a Request for Quotations (RFQ) for: 1- PN 101-810009-9, Main Landing Assembly, 2 each2- PN 101-810091-7, Drag Leg Assembly, 2 each3- PN 444EN49-6, Switch, 2 each4- PN 50-820205-21, Brace Assembly, 1 eachVendors may provide quotations for some or all of the part numbers listed. This solicitation may result in multiple awards. The quoted part numbers must meet the minimum specifications included in attachment #1. A copy of attachment #1 must be completed and submitted with the quote. The parts quoted shall meet the quality standards included in attachment #2.This procurement is a total small business set-aside.The NAICS Code and the small business size standard for this procurement are: 1. NAICS Code: 336413 Other Aircraft Part and Auxiliary Equipment Manufacturing.2. Size standard in number of 1,250 employees. The offeror shall state in their offer their size status for this procurement.All responsible sources may submit an offer which shall be considered by the agency.NASA Clause 1852.215-84 (NOV 2011), Ombudsman, is applicable. The Center Ombudsman for this acquisition can be found at http://prod.nais.nasa.gov/pub/pub_library/Omb.html-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- INSTRUCTIONS TO QUOTERS --------------------------------------------------------------------------------The provisions and clauses in this RFQ are those in effect through FAC Current to FAC 2005-92 Effective: 18 Nov 2016. Quotes are to be submitted via email to nydia.e.wilkinson@nasa.gov, not later than 2:00 pm Pacific, Dec 21, 2016. Quotes must include: 1. Solicitation number2. Delivery is required within 30 days ARO3. FOB destination to NASA Armstrong Flight Service Center Palmdale, CA 935504. Proposed delivery schedule ETA5. Discount/payment terms, warranty duration (if applicable) 6. Taxpayer identification number (TIN) 7. Identification of any special commercial terms8. Signed by an authorized company representative9. Warranty information. Please indicate the warranty on the item(s) you are offeringQuestions either contractual or technical must be via e-mail only to Nydia E. Wilkinson, at nydia.e.wilkinson@nasa.gov not later than Dec 19, 2016. Telephone questions will not be accepted*This RFQ is not an order. This is a request for information, and quotations furnished are not offers. *This RFQ does not commit the Government to pay any costs incurred in the preparation of the submission of this quotation or to contract for supplies or services. *Potential offerors will be responsible for downloading their own copy of this combination synopsis/solicitation and amendments (if any). *If quoting on item(s) on a GSA contract, in addition to entering the GSA contract number in the appropriate textbox, the quoter shall include all other pertinent GSA contract information, if available, and show all applicable discounts for each line item -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ADDITIONAL INSTRUCTIONS TO QUOTERS -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Provision FAR 52.212-1 applies to this acquisition. Offerors shall provide the information required by FAR 52.212-1 Instructions to Offerors-Commercial Items (Oct 2016), which is incorporated by reference. Addenda to FAR 52.212-1 are as follows: N/A *If the end product(s) offered is other than domestic end product(s) as defined in the clause entitled "Buy American Act -- Supplies," the offeror shall so state and shall list the country of origin. The FAR may be obtained via the Internet at URL: http://www.acquisition.gov/far/index.htmlThe NFS may be obtained via the Internet at URL: http://www.hq.nasa.gov/office/procurement/regs/nfstoc.htm-------------------------------------------------------------------------------- EVALUATION -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- FAR 52.212-2 Evaluation Commercial Items (Oct 2014)(a) The Government will award a contract resulting from this solicitation to the responsible offeror whose offer conforming to the solicitation will be most advantageous to the Government, price and other factors considered. The following factors shall be used to evaluate offers: (i) Technical capability of the item offered to meet the Government requirements. Technical capability will be determined from information submitted by the quoter which must provide sufficient details to show that the product quoted meets the Government's requirements.(ii) Price. The offeror selected for award must submit a completed copy of the provision at 52.212-3 Offeror Representations and Certifications - Commercial Items (Oct 2016), Alternate I (Oct 2014) with their offer. The provision may be obtained via the internet at URL: http://farsite.hill.af.mil/reghtml/regs/far2afmcfars/fardfars/far/52_000.htmThese representations and certifications will be incorporated by reference in any resultant contract.

Solicitation Title: Joint Primary Aircraft Training System Post Production Sustaining Engineering and Program Management Services
Description Text: Air Force Life Cycle Management Center, Training Aircraft Division, intends to award a sole source Firm-Fixed Price contract for up to fifty (50) months of Post Production Sustaining Engineering and Program Management (SEPM) services to Beechcraft Defense Company (BDC), LLC, 201 S. Greenwich, Wichita, KS 67207-1402. Market research was conducted and it has been determined this effort is a sole source requirement IAW FAR 6.302-1, Only One Responsible Source and No Other Supplies or Services Will Satisfy Agency Requirements.The Post Production SEPM contract will provide program management and engineering services to support the Joint Primary Aircraft Training System (JPATS) fleet of 744 T-6 A/B/D aircraft at nine (9) locations for up to fifty (50) months. The JPATS users include United States Air Force (USAF), United States Navy (USN), and United States Army (USA) and foreign customers participating in JPATS Foreign Military Sales (FMS). SEPM services include but are not limited to: systems engineering support, program management support, integrated logistics support, field service representative support, Diminishing Manufacturing Sources and Material Sources (DMSMS) management, study and analysis of aircraft deficiencies, as needed operation of a depot-level aircraft modification line, contractor field team activities, aircraft crash damage repair, individual aircraft tracking, aircraft structural integrity and engine structural integrity efforts, configuration and data management, technical manual updates, and design, development, testing, and supplemental military or Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) certification of engineering changes necessary to correct component deficiencies or to introduce product enhancements into the aircraft fleets via retrofit. The contractor will also provide required FAA serviceability documentation and management of Government Furnished Property (GFP) supplied during the performance of this contract.BDC, as the OEM, provides highly specialized support as they own the T-6 engineering data and drawings. BDC designed and developed the T-6 platform and is the only source for all historical and current proprietary data, such as: developmental design and approval data, prototype data, and qualification and test data. These data are required to perform the sustaining engineering function for the T-6 program including damage assessment, occasional prototype of the repair, and development of repair instructions, when the extent of damage is unknown and/or needed repairs are non-standard. As ascertained through market research, other companies did not define a methodology that allowed them to obtain/recreate the engineering data necessary to support the program. The breadth of these data would include engineering drawings, stress analyses, durability and damage tolerance analysis, thermal and electrical margins, or other required documentation. BDC's refusal to sell/lease data combined with other sources lack of mitigation strategies to obtain the technical data required to perform the specifications contained herein would create unacceptable delays in fulfilling the agency's needs.Additionally, BDC owns the FAA type certificate on the T-6 aircraft. Their responsibilities as the type certificate owner include supporting the aircraft in the field by supplying parts and engineering services. The T-6 Program Office must have a relationship with BDC based on continued operation of the fleet. If someone other than BDC was to attempt to perform SEPM services that organization would need to have access to BDC data for repairs outside of the Structural Repair Manual, ADs, SBs, etc.A sole source award for more than one year is required to ensure there is no interruption in critical sustaining engineering services and program management support. If support services are interrupted, there will be a break in the training pipeline of pilots for the USAF and USN, severely impacting the ability of those services to provide required trained pilots into the mobility and combat aircraft pilot training pipelines. USA test and evaluation activities would be equally impacted if engineering services necessary to keep the T-6D aircraft in the air were suddenly removed.This is a notice of intent, not a solicitation. Responsible sources, however, may submit a capability statement, proposal, or quotation which shall be considered by the Air Force if received within fifteen (15) calendar days of the posting of this notice. Any respondent is to specify in its response whether it is a large business, small business, small disadvantaged business, 8(a) concern, women-owned small business, HUBZone small business, veteran-owned small business or service disabled veteran-owned small business.Respondents should also specify whether they are a U.S. or foreign-owned firm. Any responses will be considered by this office before a final decision is made to solicit and negotiate with only one source in accordance with FAR 6.3012-1. "Only One Responsible Source and No Other Supplies or Services Will Satisfy Agency Requirements." The Government is not responsible for any costs incurred by responding to this notice. A determination by the Government not to compete this action is based on responses received is solely within the discretion of the Government.Any questions regarding this acquisition should be directed to the Contract Negotiator, Sara Gebhard, at (937) 904-4247 or email: sara.gebhard@us.af.mil or the Contracting Officer, Joseph Fountain at (937) 904-4609 or email: joseph.fountain@us.af.mil.Ms. Jill Willingham-Allen, AFLCMC/AQP, Wright-Patterson AFB, OH 45433, has been appointed as Ombudsman to hear concerns from offerors, or potential offerors. The purpose of the Ombudsman is to communicate contractor concerns, issues, disagreements and recommendations to the appropriate government personnel. Existence of the Ombudsman does not diminish the authority of the Program Director or the Contracting Officer. Accordingly, the Ombudsman does not participate in the preparation of solicitations, the evaluation of proposals or the source selection process and, therefore, for routine matters on individual solicitations, please contact the buyer at the telephone number listed herein. When requested, the Ombudsman, Ms. Jill Willingham-Allen can be reached at (937) 255-5472, or email: jill.willinghamallen.1@us.af.mil.

Solicitation Title: RFI--Aircraft Engineering Support for NOAA AOC Fleet
Description Text:
Document Type: Request for Information (RFI) NoticeRFI Number: NMAN6000-17-00017Response Due Date: 2:00 PM (EDT), 20 October 2016Classification Code: 4212 -Local Trucking without StorageNAICS Code: 541330, Engineering Services
THIS IS A SOURCES SOUGHT/REQUEST FOR INFORMATION (RFI) ANNOUNCEMENT.  THIS IS NOT A SOLICITATION, NOR DOES IT GUARANTEE A SOLICITATION WILL BE ISSUED.  REQUESTS FOR A SOLICITATION WILL NOT RECEIVE A RESPONSE.
IMPORTANT NOTE: For companies interested in this Sources Sought/RFI notice, please ensure responses provide the requested information outlined below.  The purpose of this notice is to obtain information and identify potential sources as part of National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), Office of Marine and Aviation Operations (OMAO), Aircraft Operations Center (AOC) market research for AOC Engineering Support for Aircraft Modification and Instrumentation for the following NOAA aircraft and to see what product or products companies offer that may meet the Government's need as further defined in the attached "DRAFT" Statement of Work (SOW).
•	Gulfstream Turbo Commander AC-695A (x1)•	DeHavilland Twin Otter DHC6-300 (x4)•	Hawker Beechcraft King Air BE-350CER (x1)•	Gulfstream G-IVSP (x1)•	Lockheed WP-3D (x2)
Interested vendors are encouraged to register with https://www.fbo.gov/ to receive a notice of availability if/when a solicitation for this requirement is issued.
Contracting Office Address and Point of Contact:
Department of Commerce (DOC) National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA)Acquisition and Grants Office (AGO)Eastern Acquisition Division (EAD)Attn: James Rall Norfolk Federal Building 200 Granby Street, Suite 815Norfolk, VA 23510
Submit via email any questions with relation to the aforementioned notice to the Contract Specialist at james.rall@noaa.gov and to andrew.hildebrandt@noaa.gov by October 17, 2016 at 4:00 PM Eastern Standard Time (EST).
All contractors doing business with the acquisition office must be registered with the System for Award Management (SAM).  An award cannot be made unless the vendor is registered in SAM.  For additional information, and to register in SAM, please access the following website: https://www.sam.gov/portal/public/SAM/.  In order to register with SAM and to be eligible to receive an award from this acquisition office, all offerors must first have a Dun & Bradstreet (D&B) Data Universal Numbering System (DUNS) number.  A DUNS number may be acquired free of charge at the following website: http://fedgov.dnb.com/webform
Description:
OMAO/AOC anticipates a recurring need for services as outlined in this Sources Sough/RFI notice beyond the base year; therefore, the DOC/NOAA/AGO/EAD-Norfolk contracting office anticipates a one (1) year base contract, plus option years, for a vendor to provide engineering support, on a task order basis, and engineering technical support, utilizing an on-demand request to invoice system, for the NOAA/OMAO/AOC aircraft fleet.  This requirement will support AOC (a Center of the NOAA OMAO), which is currently located at MacDill AFB, FL.; however, NOAA's mission is to promote global environmental assessment, prediction, and stewardship of the earth's environment and the support staff at AOC operates and supports NOAA's aircraft fleet throughout the United States and around the world.
The objective of this acquisition will be for a contractor to provide AOC with engineering support through an indefinite delivery/indefinite quantity (IDIQ) utilizing an on-demand request to invoice system. The contractor will supply AOC with the specific engineering services as defined in task orders.
The contractor must have either on staff, or readily available, an FAA designated engineering representative (DER) appointed in accordance with Code of Federal Regulations, 14 CFR §183.29, who holds an engineering degree or equivalent, possesses aircraft technical knowledge and experience, and meets the qualification requirements of FAA Order 8100.8.  At a minimum, the DER must cover the disciplines of both Structural Engineering (general) and System and Equipment Engineering (electrical equipment) for CAR 3, Part 23 (normal, utility, acrobatic, and commuter), and Part 25 (transport) aircraft.
The "DRAFT" SOW provides additional information for the following:
•	Contractor Duties and Tasks;•	Typical Deliverables;•	Required Qualifications; and•	Desired Qualifications.
IMPORTANT NOTE: ALTHOUGH A "DRAFT" SOW IS BEING PROVIDED, THIS NOTICE DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A SOLICITATION.  THE "DRAFT" SOW DESCRIBES ONLY THE CURRENTLY CONTEMPLATED POSSIBLE SCOPE FOR SERVICES AND MAY VARY FROM THE WORK SCOPE IN A FINAL SOW INCLUDED IN ANY POTENTIAL FUTURE SOLICITATION.
The Government may use the responses to this notice is for market research, information, and planning purposes only.  Responses to this Sources Sought/RFI are not quotes and NOAA cannot issue any Schedule order(s) or Contract based on responses to this Sources Sought/RFI.  All information received in response to this Sources Sought/RFI marked "Proprietary" will be protected and handled accordingly.  Interested parties are responsible for adequately marking proprietary or competition sensitive information contained in their response.
Responses to the Sources Sought/RFI will not be returned.  Responders are solely responsible for all expenses associated with responding to this Sources Sought/RFI.  NOAA will not pay for information received in response to this Sources Sought/RFI.  There is no commitment by the Government to issue a solicitation, make award or awards, or to be responsible for any monies expended by industry responses to this Sources Sought/RFI.
Requested Information
The following is requested from interested companies;
(a) Submission of information.
Electronic files shall be submitted in Portable Document Format (PDF), compatible with Adobe Reader.  Information may be submitted on letterhead stationery, or as otherwise specified in the notice.  As a minimum, requested information must show-
(1) The Sources Sought/RFI number.(2) If/When the aforementioned the requirement for "AOC Engineering Support for Aircraft Modification and Instrumentation" is formerly solicited by the Government, would your company be interested in providing a quote? (3) Company name, address, telephone number, CAGE Code and DUNS number of the vendor.(4) Company point of contact name, email address, and telephone number.(5) Business size/socioeconomic category (i.e. small business, veteran-owned small business, service-disabled veteran-owned small business, Historically Underutilized Business Zone (HUBZone) small business, small disadvantaged business, and women-owned small business concern).  The NAICS code for this requirement is 541330, Engineering Services, with a small business size standard of $38.5 million.  If you are a large business, please state as much.(6) Please indicate if your company capabilities and if you are currently providing or have provided in the past three years (3) like-services similar in scope and complexity for any other Government or public sector agency.  If, so, please provide a listing of those contracts/projects with respective agencies, points of contacts, and estimated contract cost.(7) A technical description of the services being offered in sufficient detail to evaluate compliance with the requirements in the "DRAFT" SOW.(8) The appropriate North American Industry Classification Code (NAICS), if different from this Sources Sought/RFI;(9) Please state if, based upon the attached "DRAFT" SOW, there are any aspects that are unclear and/or do not allow a clear understanding of the Government's requirements. (10) Please state if, based upon the attached "DRAFT" SOW, if there are commercial industry practices that appear to differ greatly than what is being requested by the Government under the anticipated, forthcoming solicitation.
(b) NOAA encourages appropriate vendor demonstrations as a useful way for NOAA staff members to stay abreast of the types of products, technology and/or services available in the marketplace that may be useful to support NOAA operations and programs.  If necessary and required based on responses to this Sources Sought/RFI, the Government reserves the right to schedule vendor meetings and have discussions between vendor personnel and NOAA representatives regarding the capabilities of the vendor supplies/services being offered.  All vendor meetings will be authorized, approved, and conducted by the Contracting Officer to ensure they do not create a potential exclusive situation that gives competitive advantage or otherwise disadvantages participants in any potential future competition.
NAICS Title: Engineering Services

Solicitation Title: Rockwell Collins Enhanced Map (E-MAPS) Overlay and Graphical Weather Background Overlay Annual Database Subscription
Description Text:
The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), Mike Monroney Aeronautical Center (MMAC), Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, is submitting this market survey to solicit statement of interest and capabilities from all businesses that are interested in and capable of providing annual database subscription for the Rockwell Collins Enhanced Map (E-MAPS) Overlay and Graphical Weather Background Overlay to be delivered via web for FIS aircraft equipped with Rockwell Collins Integrated Flight Information System (IFIS).  The enhanced mapping contains world coverage of high and low level airways, controlled, restricted airspace, world geographic, political boundaries, background maps and eliminates the need to reference navigational paper charts.

The IFIS E-MAPS is proprietary to Rockwell Collins Pro Line 21 Avionics Systems to include engineering and codes required for the Rockwell Collins Pro Line 21 Adaptive Flight Display equipment currently installed in the FIS Beechcraft and Challenger 605 aircraft.  The proprietary equipment will only work with the Rockwell Collins Pro Line 21 IFIS/E-MAPS software.  The IFIS/E-MAPS database subscription is an annual subscription requirement for account renewal or procurement of new subscription for aircraft.  

An Integrated Flight Information System (IFIS) provides real-time critical flight data on an aircrafts Multifunction Displays (MFDs).  IFIS flight data consist of graphical weather, winds aloft, icing, turbulence and strategic information required for flight safety.  The system provides situational awareness via electronic charts for approach plates, airport diagrams, chart Notice to Airmen (NOTAM), Instrument Departure Procedures (DPs), and Standard Terminal Arrival Routes (STARs).  The IFIS requires an annual E-MAPS subscription to update system data for flight information.

The Rockwell Collins Enhanced Map (E-MAPS) Overlay and Graphical Weather Background Overlay Database is used on the IFIS.  The IFIS provides situational awareness to include visual contract with airports, approach speed, and altitude restrictions by linking aircraft position to ground features presented on the electronic charts and/or E-MAPS.  The E-MAPS provide controlled and restricted airspace information and eliminate the need for paper charts with a 28-day cycle navigational database update. 

The FIS aircraft equipped with Rockwell Collins Integrated Flight Information System (IFIS) requires an annual database subscription service for Rockwell Collins Enhanced Map (E-MAPS) Overlay and Graphical Weather Background Overlay for Period of Performance 01/1/2017 through 12/31/2017
 
The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) is 334511, Search, Detection, Navigation, Guidance, Aeronautical, and Nautical System and Instrument Manufacturing with a size standard of 1,250.

Interested firms are required to submit the attached Business Declaration form and a copy of their SBA 8(a) certification letter, if applicable.

Vendor capability statement to provide Rockwell Collins Enhanced Map (E-MAPS) Overlay and Graphical Weather Background Overlay must include product description and delivery method for new and renewal services.

In order to make this determination the FAA requires the following from interested vendors:

1.	 Capability Statement to satisfy FAAs Requirements
2.	Vendor Business size status
3.	Expertise, experience, and depth of vendor personnel
4.	Maturity, adaptability, and complexity of current technology
5.	Product or service acceptability 
6.	Availability and delivery times of products or services
7.	Production processes, quality assurance practices, facilities, maintenance and logistics support capabilities.
8.	Information about product design stability, planned design enhancements and impact on fielded products
9.	Vendor capability to offer beneficial functional or performance trade-offs in their products or services
10.	Customer references and procurement histories of other organizations of same or similar products and services, including pricing and contract performance data
11.	Customary contract or license  agreement terms and conditions
12.	Practices of vendors engaged on producing, distributing, and supporting items, such as terms for warranties, buyer financing, maintenance and packaging, and marking
13.	Availability of suitable commercial or non-developmental items, or feasibility and cost of modifying commercial or non-developmental items to meet requirements.


The responses to this market survey will be used for informational purposes only.  This is not a screening information request or request for proposal of any kind.  The FAA is not seeking or accepting unsolicited quotes or proposals.  The FAA will not pay for any information received or costs incurred in preparing the response to the market survey.  Therefore any cost associated with the market survey submission is solely at the interested vendorâ€™s expense. 

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE.  ALL QUESTIONS MUST BE IN WRITING AND EITHER MAILED OR EMAILED TO THE CONTRACTING OFFICER.  CONTACT INFORMATION BELOW.

All responses to the market survey should be received by 3:00 p.m. Central Standard Time, Friday October 14, 2016.  The FAA requires all responses, including attachments, be submitted electronically to the Contracting Office using the following:

Email:   sherrie.files@faa.gov, 

Please include â€œMARKET SURVEY RESPONSE: Rockwell Collins Enhanced Map (E-MAPS) Overlay and Graphical Weather Background Overlay Annual Database Subscriptionâ€� in the subject line of your email.  Information provided will not be released however please mark PROPRIETARY on all documents submitted as necessary.

If you are viewing this announcement through Fed Biz Ops (http://www.fbo.gov/) the attachments may not be available/viewable to you.  If so, please proceed to the FAAâ€™s Contract Opportunities Website at faaco.faa.gov to obtain the attachments.

Solicitation Title: Rockwell Collins Pro Line 21 Synthetic Vision System (SVS) Database Software
Description Text:
The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), Mike Monroney Aeronautical Center (MMAC), Oklahoma City, Oklahoma, is submitting this market survey to solicit statement of interest and capabilities from all businesses that are interested in and capable of providing annual database subscription for the Rockwell Collins Pro Line 21 Synthetic Vision System (SVS) Database Software Identification (SCID) number 832-4120-064 for Airport and Runways to be delivered via web for the King Air Beechcraft model BE-300 aircraft.

Rockwell Collins is the manufacturing source and owns the rights and data to the proprietary engineering, equipment and software coding necessary to meet the requirement.  The proprietary equipment will only work with the Rockwell Collins Pro Line 21 Synthetic Vision System software.  The SVS database subscription is an annual subscription requirement for account renewal or procurement of new subscription per aircraft.

A synthetic vision system (SVS) is an aircraft cockpit display computer-facilitated reality system that uses 3D (three-dimensional) graphics to provide clear and intuitive means of understanding the flight environment.  The SVS provides situational awareness by using terrain, obstacle, geo-political, hydrological, and other databases.  The SVS application uses a set of databases stored on board the aircraft, an image generator computer, and aircraft display unit in the cockpit. 

The FAA BE-300 modified aircraft with Rockwell Pro Line 21 Adaptive Flight Display (AFD) requires an annual database subscription service for SVS Software Identification (SCID) number 832-4120-064 for Airports and Runways for period of performance 1/1/2017 through 12/31/2017. 

The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) is 334511, Search, Detection, Navigation, Guidance, Aeronautical, and Nautical System and Instrument Manufacturing with a size standard of 1,250.

Interested firms are required to submit the attached Business Declaration form and a copy of their SBA 8(a) certification letter, if applicable.

Vendor capability statement to provide Pro Line 21 Synthetic Vision System (SVS) must include product description and, delivery method for new and renewal services.

Solicitation Title: MARKET SURVEY:  Rockwell-Collins Integration of ACSS Transponder in ProLine 21 Equipped BE-300 Aircraft
Description Text:
NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE.  ALL QUESTIONS MUST BE IN WRITING AND EITHER MAILED, FAXED OR EMAILED TO THE CONTRACTING OFFICER.  CONTACT INFORMATION BELOW.

This is a market survey for the immediate acquisition of non-recurring engineering support services and software required to integrate an ACSS Model NXT-800 transponder into the ProLine 21 equipped King Air (Be-300).  

The FAA Flight Inspection Be-300 fleet of aircraft is in the process of having the Rockwell-Collins, ProLine 21 Avionics Suite of equipment installed.  The FAA is contemplating a fixed-price contract to include the following line items for this requirement.  

Line Item 0001:  Non-recurring engineering â€“ this includes completion of the Critical Design Review; research, development, identification of functional communication signals, and documentation of these parameters and requirements to ensure functionality and that these components properly communicate through the Control Display Unit (CDU).  This information/display information will be integrated between all the various components to make sure the system will have the ability to capture and process the signals and broadcast the correct ADS-B information to ground based receivers.

Line Item 0002:  CDU-3000 Service Bulletin for 822-0882-267  to -495 (2 per aircraft) for a total of 34 each

Line Item 0003:  IOT-4110 Software (RCPN 810-0053-XXX) (2 per aircraft) for a total of 34 each

Line Item 0004:  MDT-3110 Software (RCPN-810-0042-XXX) for a total of 17

This equipment is proprietary to Rockwell-Collins under Supplemental Type Certificate (STC) SA01267WI-D.  Rockwell-Collins owns the patents, proprietary data and software applicable to all equipment, components, software, and data required for installation of this proprietary avionics system.  This equipment is required to interface with the Flight Inspection System Equipment AFIS and FIAPA used in the backend of the aircraft to test the navigation system of the National Airspace.  

The FAA intends to solicit and negotiate only with Rockwell-Collins as the original equipment manufacturer (OEM) and is the only known source that owns the rights to modify its equipment and systems.  The FAA requires the engineering expertise that Rockwell-Collins provides that includes information and data necessary to trouble shoot, analyze, test, identify and determine risk of various anomalies in addition to making necessary corrections to their equipment and/or systems software.  As the OEM, Rockwell-Collins owns the STC to add avionics functionality in the Hawker Beechcraft Models B300/B300c.  Due to the non-recurring engineering effort, this specific effort excludes any Rockwell â€“ Collins third party dealers from meeting this requirement.

Responses to this market survey will be used for informational purposes only.  This is not a screening information request or request for proposal of any kind.  The FAA is not seeking or accepting unsolicited proposals. The FAA will not pay for any information received or costs incurred in preparing the response to this market survey. Therefore any cost associated with a market survey submission is solely at the interested vendorâ€™s expense.   

The purpose of this market survey is to solicit statements of interest and capabilities from all businesses that are interested in and capable of meeting all line item requirements as noted above.  

The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) codes and size standards for this effort:

NAICS	Size Standard
336411	1,500 Employees

The Contractor must furnish all labor, tools, parts, software/hardware/firmware, expendable and consumable items, and other technical and administrative support as necessary to integrate an ACSS Model NXT-800 transponder into the ProLine 21 equipped King Air (Be-300).  

Interested firms are required to submit the attached Business Declaration form and a copy of their SBA 8(a) certification letter, if applicable.

In order to make the determination, the FAA requires the following from interested vendors in accordance with the attached documents herein: 

Capability Statement â€“ 
  â€¢  Type of services provided by your firm
  â€¢  Size and type of services provided by previous contracts 
  â€¢  Number of years in business
  â€¢  Documentation that clearly states and identifies proof of access to Rockwell-Collins proprietary data required to modify Rockwell-Collins equipment and systems.  

All responses to this market survey must be received by 4:00 p.m. Central (Oklahoma) Time, Friday, July 15, 2016.  The FAA prefers that all submittals, including attachments, be submitted electronically to the following: 

Email: kathleen.d.islas@faa.gov 

If email is your method of submission, please include "MARKET SURVEY RESPONSE: Rockwell-Collins Integration of ACSS Transponder in ProLine 21 Equipped BE-300 Aircraft in the subject line of your email. Information provided will not be released but please mark PROPRIETARY on all documents submitted as necessary.

Solicitation Title: T-1 COMBS Site Visit
Description Text:
7 JUN 2016As a result of an administrative error, the dates were inadvertently listed as 22-23 July.  The correct anticipated site visit dates are 21-22 July 2016.  All other information in the previous posting remains unchanged.The response date remains unchanged:  05 July 2016 NLT 4:00PM CST.6 JUN 2016T-1A COMBS--Site Visit Information
 In anticipation of a solicitation, the government anticipates holding a site visit at Randolph Air Force Base, TX on 22-23 JUL 2016. The intent of this site visit is to allow potential offerors to view the current T-1A COMBS facilities and maintenance hangars.  This visit will include a group question and answer session and group viewing opportunities of the MOBs.  In addition, the government will allow one-on-one questions and answer sessions upon request.  Questions and answers from this event will be posted to FBO after the site visit.  The Government encourages potential offerors to participate in the visit, however attendance is not required as part of the solicitation process. The Air Force will NOT assume liability for costs incurred by an attendee or travel expenses. Therefore, attendee cost in response to this notice is NOT considered an allowable direct charge to the Government.
 To secure your ability to attend this event you must submit a request to attend to Ms. Tallie Cuzzort (talami.cuzzort.2@us.af.mil) by email only - no phone calls please. 
Due to facility constraints and time limitations, the site visit will be limited to no more than six (6) attendees from each potential offeror (including subcontractors). Please provide the following minimum information for access to the meeting facility when expressing intent to attend the upcoming site visit:
 
Company Information:
POC name, title, telephone number, facsimile number, and e-mail address
Company name
Company address
Size status for NAICS 488190
Cage Code
 
Attendee information:
Official name (as on state driver license)
Date of Birth
Driver license number and state of issue
 
All requests to attend must be received NLT 4:00 PM CST 05 JUL 2016. All questions and comments must be in writing, no telephone calls or in-person meetings are permitted at this time. An email confirmation will be sent upon receipt with specific meeting details (location, time, etc). Late registration and "walk-in" requests will NOT be permitted. Attendees must present a current photo ID (driver's license, military ID or passport) matching the attendee information submitted via registration. Attendees are encouraged to arrive early to permit sufficient time for check-in. This is an UNCLASSIFIED event, no clearances are required. There is no solicitation package available at this time. Interested parties are encouraged to register to receive notifications through Federal Business Opportunities.
 25 May 2016  Request for Information -- T-1 COMBS Follow-On
THERE IS NO SOLICITATION AVAILABLE AT THIS TIME.  This Request for Information (RFI) is in support of Market Research being conducted by the United States Air Force to identify potential sources and to determine if this effort can be competitive and/or a Small Business Set-Aside.  This is not a Request for Proposal (or solicitation) or an indication that a contractual commitment will exist for this requirement. The government does not intend to award a contract on the basis of this market research.  No funds are available to fund the information solicited. 
The AFLCMC/WLZW T-1A office at Tinker Air Force Base is requesting information, pursuant to FAR PART 10, in support of Market Research to identify potential sources for Contractor Operated and Maintained Base Supply (COMBS) for 178 T-1A aircraft, beginning in FY18, at five (5) CONUS locations.  The Government will use this information to determine the best future acquisition strategy for this procurement, inclusive of the need to do an additional Industry Day and/or Pre-solicitation Conference.  The government does not have the associated technical data to provide to potential sources. No qualification requirements or Technical Orders exist.  Consequently, potential sources for this effort typically would be companies who have a license or agreement with the Original Equipment Manufacturer Beechcraft Defense Corporation, Cage 70898 to complete the work described, including military specific modifications.
The proposed North American Industry Classification Systems (NAICS) Code is 488190, size standard $32.5 mil.  The Government is interested in all businesses to include, Large Business, Small Business, Small Disadvantaged Businesses 8(a)s, Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Businesses, Hubzone Businesses, and Women-Owned Small Businesses. The government requests that interested parties respond to this notice if applicable and identify your small business status to the identified NAICS code.  Additionally, please provide any anticipated teaming arrangements, along with a description of similar services offered to the Government and to commercial customers for the past three years.  Any responses involving teaming agreements should delineate between the work that will be accomplished by the prime, and the work accomplished by the teaming partners.
The following scenario is for research purposes only and your candid answers will aid our strategy planning for the T-1A COMBS acquisition.   All interested parties should send company and/or descriptive literature along with responses to the following questions and any comments or questions to the Contracting Officer: Ronnie Hobbs, email:  ronald.hobbs@us.af.mil: (405) 736-7124 or address: 3001 Staff Drive STE 1AE1 104A, Tinker AFB, OK 73145-3020.  All responses should be received no later than 3:00 PM CST, 10 JUN 2016.  All questions and comments must be in writing, no telephone calls.  The Government will not pay for any information received in response to this request, nor will the Government compensate any respondent for any costs incurred in developing the information provided to the Government.      
1. Does your typical contractual arrangement with vendors and subcontractors require them to submit a small business participation report in electronic format, for ease of collection of data?  If no, does the Prime include the supplier small business participation with the company total?
2. The Government intends to include Small Business Participation as an Evaluation Factor in the Source Selection.  Currently, the Government is considering a 15% small business requirement.  This requirement is based on allowing the contractor to utilize second tier-subcontractors within their small business percentages for meeting the requirement.
Note-This is not the same as the small business subcontracting goals required by FAR 19.702, DFAR 219.708, and AFFAR 5319.7 that will be submitted within the contractors subcontracting plan.  The information submitted in response to the Small Business evaluation factor is a contractual requirement, and must be met in ordered to be determined technically acceptable.

THERE IS NO SOLICITATION AVAILABLE AT THIS TIME. The government does not intend to award a contract on the basis of this market research. No funds are available to fund the information solicited.
The AFLCMC/WLZW T-1A office at Tinker Air Force Base is requesting information, pursuant to FAR PART 10, in support of Market Research to identify potential sources for Contractor Operated and Maintained Base Supply (COMBS) for 178 T-1A aircraft, beginning in FY18, at five (5) CONUS locations. The Government will use this information to determine the best future acquisition strategy for this procurement, inclusive of the need to do an Industry Day and/or Presolicitation Conference. The government does not have the associated technical data to provide to potential sources. No qualification requirements or Technical Orders exist. Consequently, potential sources for this effort typically would be companies who have a license or agreement with the Original Equipment Manufacturer Beechcraft Defense Corporation, Cage 70898 to complete the work described, including military specific modifications.
The proposed North American Industry Classification Systems (NAICS) Code is 488190, size standard $32.5 mil. The Government is interested in all businesses to include, Large Business, Small Business, Small Disadvantaged Businesses 8(a)s, Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Businesses, Hubzone Businesses, and Women-Owned Small Businesses. The government requests that interested parties respond to this notice if applicable and identify your small business status to the identified NAICS code. Additionally, please provide any anticipated teaming arrangements, along with a description of similar services offered to the Government and to commercial customers for the past three years. Any responses involving teaming agreements should delineate between the work that will be accomplished by the prime, and the work accomplished by the teaming partners.
The Government is seeking to optimize flexibility within the Contractor Logistic Support (CLS) services contract. We are exploring pricing various levels of support into the T-1A COMBS contract as part of this initiative and are seeking industry feedback and ideas on possible contracting options. The goal is to establish a flexible contract that allows the Government to adjust required level of support as needed without driving costs or significantly increasing the risks to the Contractor or the Government. The following scenario is for research purposes only and your candid answers will aid our strategy planning for the T-1A COMBS acquisition. There is no solicitation package available at this time. All interested parties should send company and/or descriptive literature along with responses to the following questions and any comments or questions to the Contract Specialist: Susan Myers, email: Susan.Myers@us.af.mil: (405) 734-6494 or address: 3001 Staff Drive STE 1AE1 104A, Tinker AFB, OK 73145-3020. All responses should be received no later than 3:00 PM CST, 29 January 2016. All questions and comments must be in writing, no telephone calls. The Government will not pay for any information received in response to this request, nor will the Government compensate any respondent for any costs incurred in developing the information provided to the Government.
1. In the past 5 years, have you provided COMBS to customers who operate FAA Part 25 aircraft? If yes, provide answers to the sub-questions: a. Is your support for the commercial or military? If military, what branch of service?b. How many locations do you support?c. Please identify quantity and model of aircraft you support.
2. If you answered no to question #1, have you provided COMBS support, as identified in question 1 above, for other supply type systems (commercial or military)?a. If yes, please identify level of support including quantity and type of service provided.
3. We are contemplating awarding a 7 year option contract. Can your company sustain a contract for that length of time? If so, please provide responses to the statements below:a. What length of contract has your company sustained for supply services?b. What are your issues/concerns regarding this requirement for the period of performance listed above?
4. What is your typical contractual arrangement established with vendors and subcontractors?
5. Has your company had experience (in the past 5 years) providing Field Service Representative (FSR) services to a fleet of business or military type jet aircraft in multiple locations? If yes, how many locations and aircraft?
6. What advantages/disadvantages do you perceive would be obtained by using a FAR Part 12 contract?
7. The PWS states that an Over and Above (O&A) will be utilized for different types of supply and services?a. Please provide your recommendation for over and above process to streamline ease of use, decrease delay in support, and ensure parts availability.
8. What previous experience, if any, does your company have with Government contracts, specifically in the Contract Logistics Support environment? If experience is provided, answer sub-questions: a. If you had previous contracts with the Government, what types of pricing arrangements were used? b. Is your company familiar with the Government processes of contracting, billing, etc.?
9. What type incentives do you believe would best motivate you to offer continuous supply rate improvements while driving down cost? (i.e. cost, schedule, performance)
10. What do you perceive are the pros and cons of including liquidated damage penalties tied to contractual requirements?
11. What length of phase in time was most beneficial performance for your company to be successful, within other contracts?
12. The T-1A occasionally experiences Diminishing Manufacturing Sources and Material Shortages (DMSMS) and obsolete parts issues. Describe your strategy to ensure the T-1A is not affected by DMSMS during this contract period of performance.
13. Identify and describe your previous experiences with DMSMS. a. Identify unique capabilities or business relationships with suppliers and OEM to address DMSMS issues. b. Identify programs or sourcing parts systems currently used in various platforms.
14. Do you currently have the capability, either internal or partnering with a subcontractor, to develop Parts Manufacturer Approval (PMA) items for the model 400A/400T?
15. Do you have the capability to provide engine overhaul services? If so, what types of engines and what level of service has your company provide? (specifically, T-1A engine, JT15D-5B)
16. Do you currently have the capability or could partner with another company, to provide engineering support services for the T-1A? If yes, provide further information for the requirement(s) listed below but not limited to:a. Provide recurring engineering support in the following areas:i. Respond to field request for Maintenance Assistance (IAW USAF Tech Manual 00-25-107); typically provides repair procedures that are not covered by the existing repair manuals - repair procedures must not invalidate FAA type certification of the aircraft ii. Maintain relationship with aircraft OEM for changes to the baseline configuration (i.e. maintenance manual changes, service bulletins, service communications, airworthiness directives)iii. Propose Supplemental Type Certificate (STC) design solutions to common fleet issuesiv. Reverse engineering and/or engineering analysis for technical issues that arise? v. Access to proprietary datavi. Experience working with OEMs to authorize one-time flights (typically a temporary repair and flight limitations to return aircraft to home station for more extensive repairs) vii. In-Flight Emergency (IFE) support viii. Mishap investigation and recovery support
17. Do you currently have the capability, or could you provide the capability, of a designated engineering representative (DER)? The DER shall be able to provide FAA authorized/certified repair procedures that when implemented would make the aircraft, aircraft engines or parts conform to the approved type design, are in a condition for safe operation.
18. Do you have access to the current 400A Maintenance Manuals?
19. If you are required, can you propose TO changes and write them when changes are found that could save the government time or money?
20. Provide comments you feel would be beneficial in your ability to meet PWS requirements for this effort. See list below for recommended areas:a. Type of performance metric and implementation processb. Incentivesc. Datad. O&A processe. Unique Company Qualifications

Solicitation Title: Beechcraft Super King Air 300 Main Landing Wheel
Description Text:
NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE.  ALL QUESTIONS MUST BE IN WRITING AND EITHER MAILED, FAXED OR EMAILED TO THE CONTRACTING OFFICER, CONTACT INFORMATION BELOW.  THE FAA MAY CONTACT RESPONDENTS TO ACTIVELY PARTICIPATE IN COMMUNICATIONS.  THE GOAL OF THIS REQUEST FOR INFORMATION IS TO OBTAIN INFORMATION FROM INDUSTRY ABOUT POSSIBLE SOURCES.

The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA), Flight Inspection Services is conducting a Market Survey - Request for information (RFI) for possible sources for a requirement for Beechcraft Super King Air 300 (Be-300) Main Landing Wheels.  The only approved part number for this application is currently the Goodrich Wheel assembly Part Number 3-1341-1, in â€œNEWâ€� condition, or for a wheel assembly that has Parts Manufacturer Approval (PMA) for this part number that has the required approval documents issued by the Federal Aviation Administration to manufacture this specific aircraft part, or a vendor that has developed or in the process of developing a Supplemental Type Certificate for a replacement wheel for the Be-300 main landing wheels.  The FAA has a fleet of 17 Be-300 aircraft and is currently in need of â€œNewâ€� main landing wheels for replacement on the FAA Aircraft.  There are four wheels required per aircraft.  Note that the nose landing wheel is different from the main landing wheels.  

The Federal Aviation Regulation Part 21 Certification Procedures for Products and Parts and Part 43 Maintenance, Preventative Maintenance, Rebuilding, and Alteration allows 11 ways to approve parts for installation on an aircraft (See Attachment A) but for this specific part the three processes described above and the only ones applicable.  Any replacement parts must also meet the requirement of FAR Part 43 along with these original certification basis processes.  Additional limitation may be imposed by the OEM on parts as specified in the FAA approved data needed to maintain aircraft.

â€œApproved partsâ€� are identifies as parts that have met one or more of the following requirements:

â€¢	Goodrich â€œNEW Conditionâ€� wheel assembly, P/N 3-1341-1
â€¢	Produced in accordance with a Parts Manufacturer Approval (PMA) issued under 14 CFR Part 21, Subpart K.
â€¢	Produced during the Type Certificate (TC) application process under Part 21, Subpart B, or Supplemental Type Certificate (STC) application process under Part 21, Subpart E. prior to the issuance of the certificate; subsequently determined to conform to the approved TC or STC data (refer to Â§ Part 21.303(b)(1)),

Acronym definition; 

PMAâ€”parts manufacturer approval-requires approval granted by the US. Federal Aviation Administration to manufacture this specific part.

This request for information is to improve the Governmentâ€™s understanding of the current marketplace and will be used for information purposes only and will not be released.  This announcement is not a Screening Information Request (SIR) or a Request for Proposal (RFP) of any kind.  We are asking for a Rough Order of Magnitude price estimate for a â€œNEWâ€� condition wheel, and any cost associated with this item and documentation showing that you are currently in the process of getting certification on a part or have the original Part Numbered item in â€œNewâ€� condition and number of units available.  

All interested parties are advised that the FAA will not pay for any information or any administrative costs incurred that are associated with any response received from industry in response to this Market Survey/RFI.  Therefore, any costs associated with Market Survey/Request for Information submissions will be solely at the interested partyâ€™s expense.

Responders are required to complete and return to the FAA a copy of the System Capabilities Document - Attachment B, and the Business Declaration Form.  This information will be used to help determine the FAAâ€™s procurement strategy if and when a formal SIR is issued to determine a source list for these wheels.

The information provided in response to this market survey is for informational purposes only and will not be released.  Any proprietary information submitted will be protected if appropriately marked.  No evaluation of vendors will occur and vendor participation in any informational session is not a promise of future business with the FAA.

Solicitation Title: Data Rights and Royalty Fees via Data License Agreement (DLA)
Description Text:
The Naval Supply (NAVSUP) Systems Command, Fleet Logistics Center Jacksonville (FLCJ), FL intends to issue a sole source award utilizing Simplified Acquisition Procedures to Beechcraft Corporation for data rights and royalty fees via a Data License Agreement (DLA) for the T-44  and  T-34 Aircraft.  Beechcraft is the only source that can provide this requirement because they are the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) for the T-34 and T-44 aircraft.  As the OEM, Beechcraft owns all of the data rights, extensive pre and post-construction design analyses, testing, and results.  Without the OEMâ€™s intellectual properties, historical information, and relevant data resources, the U.S Navyâ€™s T-34  and  T-44 Trainer Fleet operations, modifications, and repair will come to a halt and the FRCSEâ€™s ability to sufficiently support the Navyâ€™s aircraft fleet demands and requirements would be negatively impacted.
  This requirement is to provide technical data usage via a Data License Agreement (DLA) including Royalty Fees assessed for each T-44  and  T-34 Aircraft inducted into the Fleet Readiness Center Southeast (FRCSE) as needed to accomplish the mission in support of the Chief of Naval Air Training (CNATRA) Fleet Support Team (FST) and FRCSE.  The Data License Agreement shall set forth the terms and conditions which shall apply to the licensing of the technical information and services provided by Beechcraft to the Government in support of the program.  This agreement shall be in effect throughout the life of the contract (including all option year periods).  Technical data usage includes access to Beechcraft specifications, structures, and systems drawings.
  Technical data usage will be limited in scope to aircraft inducted for Depot-level maintenance at Fleet Readiness Center Southeast (FRCSE).  A royalty fee will be assessed for each T-34 and T-44 inducted into FRCSE.  

The applicable North American Industrial Classification System Code (NAICS) code that this work falls under is 541330 Engineering Services, with a size standard of $15M.  This notice of intent is for information purposes only.  All sources eligible to provide this requirement must respond in writing.  Responses must be supported with clear and convincing evidence to clearly articulate the ability to provide this requirement as outlined above.  A request for documentation will not be considered as an affirmative response.
  If no responses are received, within 10 calendar days after publication of this notice, to the effect that comparable items are available, and that it is more advantageous to the Government than obtaining this product through a sole-source contract, then a sole source acquisition award will be made.  

Response to this notice is to be sent to wendy.colon@navy.mil.
NAICS Title: Engineering Services

Solicitation Title: C-12W Aircraft Procurement
Description Text:
Naval Air Systems Command at Patuxent River, MD has a requirement for the procurement of one (1) C-12W aircraft with options for four (4) additional C-12W aircraft.  The Government intends to enter into sole source negotiations with and subsequently award a Firm Fixed Price contract to Beechcraft Corporation (under ownership of Textron Aviation) by the authority of FAR 6.302-1, only one responsible source and no other supplies or services will satisfy agency requirements.  Beechcraft Corporation is the original designer and manufacturer for the King Air 350 aircraft, designated C-12W by the Navy.  Beechcraft Corporation is the only complete source of historical, design, development, manufacturing, modification, test, and flight certification data for the King Air 350 aircraft. 
 This notice is not a request for competitive proposals and no solicitation is available. However, interested parties may submit a capability statement.  The government reserves the right to process this procurement as a sole source based on the responses received. The closing date for this synopsis is 4 April 2016 at 4:00 P.M. Eastern Daylight Time. The anticipated award date is December 2016. For information regarding this announcement, contact Contract Specialist Lindsay Hurley via e-mail at Lindsay.hurley@navy.mil. No telephone inquiries will be accepted.  Companies interested in subcontracting opportunities should contact Lyn Roberts at lroberts2@txtav.com or (316) 676-8558.
NAICS Title: Aircraft Manufacturing

Solicitation Title: Aerial Supervision Module (ASM) Operational Usage and Analysis
Description Text: THIS IS A NOTICE OF INTENT TO AWARD A SOLE-SOURCE CONTRACT AND IS NOT A REQUEST FOR COMPETITIVE PROPOSALS.The intent of this Special Notice is for informational purposes only. The U.S. Department of Agriculture, Forest Service, Acquisition Management, Incident Support Branch (AQM ISB) intends to award a sole source requirements contract to The Beechcraft Corporation, DBA Textron Aviation for Aerial Supervision Module (ASM) Operational Usage Analysis1.	This new effort would take the loads data collected between the 2009 effort and the present. Data presented will include the ASM / Leadplane operational loads housed in the Forest Service database as well as the preliminary report compiled by Wichita State University through a grant from the FAA. Areas of emphasis from the data collected and the preliminary report are as follows:1.1.	A very small percentage of the flights were in the extreme-attitude category with pitch and roll angles exceeding ±30 and ±80 degrees.1.2.	With flaps extended, the limit load factor of +2.00 g was exceeded in a large number of firefighting cases.1.3.	Maximum indicated airspeed was exceeded in a noticeable number of cases.2.	Tasks2.1.	Based on the data collected, evaluate and update the structural inspection program intervals to include any new areas identified based on the mission usage. 2.2.	Identify any additional inspections, overhaul limits or life limits based on the current data. For example, evaluate and identify modifications needed for the aircraft maintenance program to include the following aircraft exceedances: roll, pitch, Vne, g exceedances with flaps retracted and deployed2.3.	Identify any additional actions that should be incorporated into the maintenance program.2.4.	Given the mission mix identified in the data, provide projections of the aircraft lifecycle used in this mission for 300 hours per year over a 20 year life. Identify any additional lifecycle cost based on the mission usage.The statutory authority for this one year sole source procurement is FAR 6.302-1, Only One Responsible Source and No Other Supplies or Services Will Satisfy Agency Requirements. Beechcraft is the manufacturer and as such has access to data and engineering that is only available to the manufacturer and data that will be required to perform the requested analysis and provide approved changes to the maintenance schedules of the aircraft. This notice of intent is NOT a request for proposals or quotes; however, all responsible sources may submit a quotation and technical capabilities, which, if received within 15 calendar days of publication of this notice shall be considered by the Government. All responses must be submitted to the Government primary point of contact at the contracting office address shown below. If no written responses are received after the publication of this notice the contract will be awarded without further notice. A determination by the Government not to open the requirement to competition based upon the responses to this notice is solely within the discretion of the Government.
NAICS Title: Other Support Activities for Air Transportation

Solicitation Title: USMC C-12W Aircraft Procurement
Description Text:
This Sources Sought notice is being posted to satisfy the requirement of Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement 206.302-1(d). The Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIRSYSCOM) intends to award a contract for the procurement of one (1) United States Marine Corps (USMC) C-12W with the options to procure four (4) additional Aircraft. This procurement will be awarded on a sole source basis to Beechcraft (Cage Code 70898), Wichita, KS. Beechcraft is the original and sole designer and manufacturer of the C-12W aircraft
Beechcraft is the only known responsible source capable of meeting the current USMC requirement, and that possesses the engineering data, technical skills, and requisite knowledge of the design, performance, and operational characteristics of the C-12W aircraft. Therefore, Beechcraft is the only source that can provide the C-12W aircraft.
THIS NOTICE OF INTENT IS NOT A REQUEST FOR COMPETITIVE PROPOSALS. This acquisition is being pursued on a sole source basis under the statutory authority of 10 U.S.C. 2304(c)(1), as implemented in FAR 6.302-1, only one responsible source and no other type of supplies or services will satisfy agency requirements. This notice of intent is not a request for competitive proposals; however, the Government will consider all responses received to this notice. A determination by the Government not to compete this requirement is solely within the discretion of the Government. No solicitation will be available for this procurement. Information provided herein is subject to change and in no way binds the Government to solicit or award a contract.
NAICS Title: Aircraft Manufacturing
